title: ACCESSORY USES FOR A PRINCIPAL COMMERCIAL USE
content:
(A)

The provisions of this section supersede the requirements of Section 25-2-894 (Accessory Uses for a Principal Commercial Use) to the extent of conflict.

(B)

The following are permitted as accessory uses in a commercial recreation zoning district:

(1)

food sales;

(2)

general retail sales (convenience);

(3)

personal improvement services;

(4)

restaurant (limited) without drive-in service;

(5)

day care services (general);

(6)

day care services (limited); and

(7)

safety services.

(C)

An accessory use described in Subsection (B) may occupy not more than 50 percent of
the site area or of the gross floor area of the structures on the site.

Source: Section 13-2-304; Ord. 990225-70; Ord. 031211-11; Ord. 031211-41.
